The transparency issue is probably caused because gratings are rendered before walls. Walls are then not rendered at the same pixels. This is how 3D graphics works. You can only fix this by making gratings texture to have only fully-transparent and fully-opaque pixels.

If you want really big, check out KOSMOS. 350MB on disk with a load of parts. The thing cracks out my computer. With full-sized textures I think it runs at least 1GB of RAM by itself!

Average part "size" is around 5MB per part for tga or mbm textures at 1024x1024. This mod even has three IVAs which all are extra weight on memory, so to be only 18.9MB is actually pretty darn good. I've seen individual IVAs weigh in at 25MB, I think.

If the size still worries you, check out the Active Memory Reduction Mod. Saves me about 1GB of memory running a ton of mods (including B9, KW, NovaPunch, Infernal Robotics, FAR, and KAS).
